page.title: 01PREFACE- THE MENDIP PLATEAU
page.content: The block is part of the Mendip limestone plateau, most of it at least 250 metres above sea level. It is situated at the very top of Cheddar Gorge and is cut by the valleys:_ Velvet Bottom, Longwood & the Gorge. Arable farming forms the base of the local economy, usually wheat & barley growing. Sheep grazing, dairy & pig breeding also occur. There is an outdoor activity centre at Charterhouse and an army firing range at Yoxter. This remote area has few main roads or amenities and is popular for outdoor recreation. Important conservation areas are included within the block. Settlement consists of isolated farms.
